Name: Power plug standard
Description: A power plug standard is a defined shape and electrical rating defining a connection to a power supply.

Properties.Name: Fused
Properties.Description: Indicates whether a plug standard requires a fuse.  A fuse is an automatic switch which breaks the connection if the rated current is exceeded.

Properties.Name: Grounded
Properties.Description: The presence of a means of grounding this plug, normally a third pin

Properties.Name: Type
Properties.Description: The grouping of this plug e.g. type A, B or K etc..

Properties.Name: Polarised
Properties.Description: Indicates whether the plug standard supports polarisation - i.e. one connector is neutral and the other live.  This is a safety feature of many standards

Properties.Name: Rated Current
Properties.Description: The maximum current for which this standard allows

Properties.Name: Rated voltage
Properties.Description: The maximum allowed voltage across this plug as defined by this standard
